info.description: API to retrieve the usage count of metrics of various channels and business transactions for a particular date
info.title: Transaction Usage Statistics

get.summary: To get Usage statistics by date

parameters.name: resourceReference
parameters.description: Contains the resource name. This is a broader classification of the grouped records. Example: Arrangements are displayed as CONTRACTS, PAYMENT.ORDER records as PAYMENT.ORDER, POR.TRANSACTION records as PAYMENTS etc.

parameters.name: metricType
parameters.description: Contains the type of metering metric that are to be displayed. Example: ENTRIES, QUERIES, PAYMENTS etc.  For Arrangements, it will contain product line DEPOSITS#<<each product group under the product line>>, LOANS#<<each product group under the product line>>, ACCOUNTS#<<each product group under the product line>> etc.

parameters.name: metricTypeMatches
parameters.description: Contains the strings that the metricType of a record has to match for the record to be selected

parameters.name: meteredDate
parameters.description: Contains the metering date stored in the recorded profile

parameters.name: meteredDateLessThan
parameters.description: Indicates the meteredDate value below which selection has to be made

parameters.name: meteredDateLessThanOrEquals
parameters.description: Indicates the meteredDate value below or equal to which selection has to be made

parameters.name: meteredDateGreaterThan
parameters.description: Indicates the meteredDate value above which selection has to be made

parameters.name: meteredDateGreaterThanOrEquals
parameters.description: Indicates the meteredDate value above or equal to which selection has to be made

parameters.name: meteredDateBetween
parameters.description: Indicates the range in which meteredDate has to be in for the record to be selected

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001.

parameters.name: disablePagination
parameters.description: Indicates the pagination header attributes availability. If set to 'true', it fetches all the data

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

page_size.description: The total number of records per page

page_start.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

total_size.description: The total number of records present

page_token.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request

resourceReference.description: Contains the resource name. This is a broader classification of the grouped records. Example: Arrangements are displayed as CONTRACTS, PAYMENT.ORDER records as PAYMENT.ORDER, POR.TRANSACTION records as PAYMENTS etc.

meteredDate.description: Contains the metering date stored in the recorded profile

metricType.description: Contains the type of metering metric that are to be displayed. Example: ENTRIES, QUERIES, PAYMENTS etc.  For Arrangements, it will contain product line DEPOSITS#<<each product group under the product line>>, LOANS#<<each product group under the product line>>, ACCOUNTS#<<each product group under the product line>> etc.

metricCount.description: Contains the number of transactions posted for a given metric

isIncremental.description: Indicates whether the metric count measured is incremental or total count for the specific metric type. This will contain, either  'true' or a 'false'.

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

code.description: The identifier of the error message
The identifier of the error message

message.description: The actual t24 error message for bad requests

type.description: The identifier of error type: Business

code.description: The identifier of the error message

message.description: The actual t24 error message caused by server

type.description: The identifier of error type: System
